turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Mint Las Vegas.
turn.1: What television show was filmed at The Mint Las Vegas?
turn.2: In the 1975 episode of "Kojak" titled "A House of Prayer, a Den of Thieves", a sniper shoots a witness who Kojak has arrested from a room at the Mint.
turn.4: The casino can also be seen several times towards the end of the 1987 U2 music video "I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For", which was filmed entirely on Fremont Street.
turn.6: A computer-generated reconstruction of the casino can be seen in the 1998 film "Fear and Loathing In Las Vegas".
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: A casino in Tunica, Mississippi was used to depict the Mint in the 2005 film "Walk the Line".
turn.10: The Mint is also seen in music videos by Panic! at the Disco from their 2013 album, "Too Weird to Live, Too Rare to Die!" and also featured in Father John Misty's video for ""Mr. Tilman"."
